title: Community History Scan Days
short: Help us fund Community History Scan Days for our community.
description: This project will improve library service for local patrons. Your gift supports materials staffing and outreach. Every dollar helps us serve more people with welcoming spaces and tools.

title: Keep Our Library Public!
short: We believe that all of the Blasco Erie County Public Library belongs to the public!
description: Keep Our Library Public (KOLP) has filed a legal complaint in the Erie County Court of Common Pleas to prevent 3200 square feet of Blasco Erie County Public Library in Erie County, PA from being leased to a tax-exempt, private, religious university. Please help us fund our legal fight!  Donations given through FundLibraries.org are tax deductible.

title: Teen Study Lounge Refresh
short: Help us fund Teen Study Lounge Refresh for our community.
description: This project will improve library service for local patrons. Your gift supports materials staffing and outreach. Every dollar helps us serve more people with welcoming spaces and tools.

title: TEST Free Little Libraries of Virginia
short: TEST Free Little Libraries of Virginia
description: TEST Free Little Libraries of Virginia aims to build 10 Little Libraries in rural areas of Virginia where there are more than 25 miles between library branches.
organization: TEST Free Little Libraries of Virginia

title: Books Beyond Bars: Bringing Hope Through Reading
short: Help us bring books, literacy workshops, and library access to people who are incarcerated — because everyone deserves the freedom to read.
description: Access to books can transform lives, but in many correctional facilities across the U.S., libraries are underfunded or nonexistent. With your support, Books Beyond Bars will. Build library collections of educational, vocational, and recreational books in underserved prisons. Host literacy and reentry workshops to prepare people for success after release. Partner with formerly incarcerated advocates to make sure programs are meaningful and accessible. Your gift directly funds book purchases, secure shelving, and stipends for educators leading workshops. Together, we can break cycles of illiteracy and empower thousands of people behind bars.

title: Funding for EveryLibrary Institute (TEST)
short: This is a test campaign to provide funding for ELI.
description: This is a test campaign to provide funding for ELI. Volunteers supporting books programs and community events around the country and support to fight against book bans and censorship.

title: Check Out a G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Trimmers)
short: The Library  would like to obtain goats for our library  of things, to enable library  patrons to check out a pair of goats.
description: The Anytown Public Library is thinking outside the book with its latest Library of Things fundraiser: goats! That’s right—soon you’ll be able to check out a pair of eco-friendly, four-hooved lawnmowers to help with brush clearing and yardwork. Studies (conducted chiefly by the goats themselves) show that one goat can consume approximately 3,000 weeds per day—though results vary if dandelions are in season. Please donate today and help us shelve some goats right next to the pressure washers and pickleball sets!

title: Boost the Children’s Reading Nook
short: Help us fund Boost the Children's Reading Nook for our community.
description: This project will improve library service for local patrons. Your gift supports materials staffing and outreach. Every dollar helps us serve more people with welcoming spaces and tools.

title: Help fight corruption in Coulterville
description: Help fight corruption in Coulterville - demand accountability, compliance, and transparency for the residents of the Coulterville Public Library District.

title: Bilingual Books for Families
short: Help us fund Bilingual Books for Families for our community.
description: This project will improve library service for local patrons. Your gift supports materials, staffing, and outreach. Every dollar helps us serve more people with welcoming spaces and tools that encourage reading and library experiences for every familiy in our community.

title: Local Zine Library Starter
short: Supporters building unique local collections for creators.
description: This project will improve library service for local patrons. Your gift supports materials staffing and outreach. Every dollar helps us serve more people with welcoming spaces and tools.

title: Books & Blooms Community Garden
short: Help us turn a vacant lot next to the library into a community garden—complete with outdoor reading nooks and a seed-swap kiosk.
description: We’re combining nature and literature! With your support we’ll: Build raised beds and benches. Install weather-proof shelves stocked with donated titles. Host bi-weekly garden storytimes and seed swaps. All funds go toward materials, plants, and a part-time garden coordinator. Let’s grow community, one book at a time! test

title: Help Support Read Freely Alabama
short: Our state-wide grassroots group needs your help to fight back against anti-library extremism and censorship
description: Your generous donations go to fund our advocacy and outreach events, legislative initiatives, supplies, and technology/software to allow us to continue the fight against extremism in Alabama.

title: Storytime on Wheels
short: Help us convert a vintage food truck into a pop-up picture-book library that can roll into parks and community events all summer long.
description:
Why a mobile storytime?  

Many families in East Portland live miles from a branch library. Storytime on Wheels brings books, puppets, and lively read-alouds right to them. Your donation funds:  
• Custom shelving and book bins  
• A wheelchair-accessible ramp  
• Fuel and driver stipend through Labor Day  

Every $25 outfits the truck with a brand-new hardcover. Let’s put 300 stories on the street!
